question: What is the Medecins Sans Frontieres (MSF)?
option1:
An agency formed by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) to check misuse of
drugs by sportspersons
option2: A non-government organization which specializes in international which specializes in international humanitarian aid and emergency medical assistance
option3: An organization to develop applications of nanotechnology in medicine
option4: An organization of medical practioners funded by the European Union which carries out research against spread of AIDS
answer: A non-government organization which specializes in international which specializes in international humanitarian aid and emergency medical assistance
explanation: Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) translates to Doctors without Borders. We provide medical assistance to people affected by conflict, epidemics, disasters, or exclusion from healthcare. MSF was founded in 1971 in Paris by a group of journalists and doctors.
